document.docAuthor: Bologna, Marco A., Poloni, Riccardo & Vázquez, Xavier A.
document.masterDocTitle: A new Ischnomera of the I. xanthoderes (Mulsant, 1858) complex (Coleoptera Oedemeridae) from Sicily

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new Ischnomera of the I. xanthoderes (Mulsant, 1858) complex (Coleoptera Oedemeridae) from Sicily

bibRefCitation.refString: Abeille de Perrin, E. (1896) Description d'un Serropalpide et de trois Oedemerides nouveaux (Col.). Bulletin de la Societe entomologique de France, 1896, 283 - 285.

Examined specimens from Theniet El Had are topotypic ( Abeille de Perrin, 1896 , as Teniet el Had). Limited literature information on the distribution includes four localities from Morocco (Tarhzef, Atlas Medio, 2000 m ; Oulmes; Rabat (alr.); Talmest, Gran Atlas Central, 2000 m : Kocher, 1938 , 1956 , as
Asclera xanthoderes
), three northern Algerian localities ( Bedel, 1885 as
Asclera xanthoderes
; Abeille de Perrin, 1895: two of which were confirmed in this paper) and another not confirmed (Edough: Mayet, 1903 ), and one NW Tunisian site close to the Algerian border ( Švihla, 1988 ), confirmed by the examination of additional specimens (see above). The distribution of this species is illustrated in Fig. 8 .

Taxonomic remarks. Male genitalia of this species are illustrated in Figs. 1b, d , 2c, d . The aedeagus is straight as in
I. sicula
, but distinctly shorter and thicker, parameres are distinctly more setose and less divergent than in the Sicilian species. Tarsal claws without a distinct tooth ( Figs. 2h and 3b ).
